subject: If a test fails (on an error), is tearDown called anyway?

messageBody:
Hi,

In the process of debugging my transaction problem reported last Friday, I
decided to recode the offending tests so they are no longer transactional.
I've found that if the test is run alone, it passes, but if it is run within
a slew of test suites (AllTests), it fails. If we take the test suite for
the offending class and put it first in AllTests, it passes.

In our transactional tests, the tearDown method ends the transaction. If a
test fails because of an error, is tearDown called nevertheless? Has anyone
seen weird side effects where a test run standAlone passes but fails when
run with others?

No, at this point, I can't say that it's due to data cleanup. All our tests
recreate data when they are run. Furthermore, most of our data uses database
sequence numbers as the primary key so every test run uses a new set of
data. Even if previous data was still in the DB, it can't be mapped to the
new data.

L
